Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Jen Hoyle.
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jennifer Hoyle
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jennifer Hoyle:She was an excellent Teaching Fellow for this course.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Jim MacBroom is a great instructor. Unlike many of the faculty here, he is a true practitioner, and he obviously thinks like one. He has a skillset that is both broad and thorough, he's very entertaining, and he's hugely knowledgeable about the topic at hand, of course. Terrific instructor.
Great class taught by a great instructor and TA. The course is different from many other FES courses in that it is practice oriented instead of being strictly theory based.
Question 13: Overall, I very much enjoyed the course, including the lectures, readings, and field trips.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Knowledge from someone working in the field.
I found the field trips incredibly interesting, entertaining, and educational. In fact, they were some of the most valuable class sessions I've had here at FES.

Jim is a great instructor with a lot of experience and enthusiasm for his work. He is able to his knowledge through the course and expose students to the basic aspects of hydro-engineering and river restoration.
The field trips were extremely helpful for better understanding the course material.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Like I said above, the trips were great. That said, there weren't enough of them. I really think I learned more in a few trips than in the rest of the classes combined â not that the sessions in the classroom were so bad, but it's just incredibly helpful to see the concepts illustrated out in the field. So it would be fantastic if this course could somehow squeeze in a few more trips.
Additional field trips would help, but the course was excellent as is.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Perfectly complimentary.
No lab sections.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Jenn was great! She's obviously very knowledgeable and experienced, and she wasn't afraid to speak up in class when Jim wasn't quite making himself clear. She was also very helpful outside of class and easy to contact.
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn was an extremely helpful TA.
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  She was extremely helpful and always available to answer questions. Nothing can be improved.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Exactly my area of study.

I'm trying to take a bunch of water classes in preparation for my future in coastal/marine/freshwater conservation/policy. I'm really more of a coastal and marine guy, but I figured I'd give rivers a shot, since obviously they interact closely with coastal systems, and I thought some of the science might be applicable.
This course was pivotal in helping me better understand river processes and restoration methods used for water resource management.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See above â interested in coastal science and conservation, and obviously rivers and coastlines interact in many ways. I'm also really interested in anadromous fish, and figured this course would be a good lesson in their conservation.
I wanted to learn more about river restoration techniques.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Exceeded my expectations.
Yes, definitely. I learned a lot more hydrology than I expected, and I also learned a lot about the techniques and strategies that engineers use in conducting river restorations.
Yes
Yes, most definitely.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was great to work with my fellow students.

We divided labor effectively, and I learned a lot from students who had more technical/hydrological aptitude than me. Additionally, I was absent from a couple of classes due to conferences, and my peers definitely helped fill me in.
It was helpful to brainstorm ideas together and hear different points of view working together in a group.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Great course, take it.
Take it! You won't regret it, and your final project might actually help inform policy.
Very worthwhile for students interested in rivers.

I would recommend learning as much as they can from the lectures, reading material, and field trips, as there is a wealth of knowledge about practical skills in river restoration that they will gain from this course.
